intro: Polygala wattersii, commonly known as the Watters' milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae, which includes over 700 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, and it thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Polygala wattersii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
